description: This ping is intended to provide a measure of the usage of MozPhab. It's generated after a command is finished.
name: usage

metrics.name: mozphab.environment.distribution_version
metrics.description: Version number of the Operating System or distribution name and version for Linux.

metrics.name: mozphab.environment.python_version
metrics.description: Python version

metrics.name: mozphab.environment.vcs.name
metrics.description: Name of the underlying version control system

metrics.name: mozphab.environment.vcs.version
metrics.description: Version of the underlying version control system

metrics.name: mozphab.submission.commits_count
metrics.description: A total number of commits in the stack.

metrics.name: mozphab.submission.files_count
metrics.description: A total number of files submitted.

metrics.name: mozphab.submission.files_size
metrics.description: A distributed size of all files in the submitted stack

metrics.name: mozphab.submission.preparation_time
metrics.description: Time spent on preparing the commit stack.

metrics.name: mozphab.submission.process_time
metrics.description: Time spent on performing the submission. This metric will be null if the users decides to discontinue submission process after the preparation step.

metrics.name: mozphab.usage.arcanist
metrics.description: True if MozPhab was forced to use Arcanist

metrics.name: mozphab.usage.command
metrics.description: Command used to run MozPhab, e.g. `submit` or `patch`.

metrics.name: mozphab.usage.command_time
metrics.description: Time spent on performing the command

metrics.name: mozphab.usage.override_switch
metrics.description: True if a --force switch was used to override validation

metrics.name: mozphab.user.id
metrics.description:
Unique identifier of each MozPhab user. The default `client_id` will change if the user would delete the `telemetry-data` directory. The `user.id` metric is created by hashing the email, which will be the same for all MozPhab installations.
We store the user identification in a file that is updated every week. We want to change the `user.id` metric when the user changes an email.

metrics.name: mozphab.user.installation
metrics.description: Unique identifier of each MozPhab installation. A user might install the application on multiple machines/profiles.

metrics.name: app_build
metrics.description:
The build identifier generated by the CI system (e.g. "1234/A").
For language bindings that provide automatic detection for this value,
(e.g. Android/Kotlin), in the unlikely event that the build identifier
can not be retrieved from the OS, it is set to "inaccessible". For other
language bindings, if the value was not provided through configuration,
this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: app_channel
metrics.description: The channel the application is being distributed on.

metrics.name: app_display_version
metrics.description:
The user visible version string (e.g. "1.0.3").

In the unlikely event that the display version can not be retrieved,
it is set to "inaccessible".

metrics.name: architecture
metrics.description: The architecture of the device, (e.g. "arm", "x86").

metrics.name: client_id
metrics.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the client.

metrics.name: device_manufacturer
metrics.description:
The manufacturer of the device the application is running on.
Not set if the device manufacturer can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: device_model
metrics.description:
The model of the device the application is running on.
On Android, this is Build.MODEL, the user-visible marketing name,
like "Pixel 2 XL".
Not set if the device model can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: first_run_date
metrics.description: The date of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_label
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set with an invalid label.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_overflow
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set a value that overflowed.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_state
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a timing metric was used incorrectly.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_value
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set to an invalid value.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: locale
metrics.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

metrics.name: os
metrics.description:
The name of the operating system.
Possible values:
Android, iOS, Linux, Darwin, Windows,
FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, unknown

metrics.name: os_version
metrics.description:
The user-visible version of the operating system (e.g. "1.2.3"). If the
version detection fails, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: android_sdk_version
metrics.description:
The optional Android specific SDK version of the software running on this
hardware device.
